div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF THOMAS L THURSTON FOR A WRIT OF habeas corpus
No. 3128 PETITION FOR WRIT
To the Honorable Judges of the above entitled District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
The petition of the above named THOMAS L THURSTON for a Writ of habeas corpus, respectfully shows to the Court:
I
That your Petitioner is a citizen of the United States and a resident of the State of Washington within said Western District of Washington
II

That your Petitioner is now being unlawfully detained and restrained of his liberty by O.P. Halligan, as Warden of the United States Penitentiary, at McNeil Island, Pierce County, State of Washington, and within the jurisdiction of this Court
III
That your Petitioner is in such custody under and by color of the authority of the United States and is in such custody in violation of the constitution and laws of the United States
IV
That the facts concerning said unlawful detention of your Petitioner are as follows, to-wit:

That on or about the 23rd day of July 1914, a pretended indictment was found against your Petitioner in the United States District Court for the District and Territory for Alaska, Fourth Judicial District, holding terms at Iditarod, for the alleged crime of detaining, delaying and embezzling mail matter.

That thereafter such proceedings were had in said Court that
your Petitioner was convicted by a jury in said Court of the said alleged crime of detaining, delaying and embezzling mail matter and one or about the 15th day of July 1915, a pretended judgment was entered against your Petitioner wherein and whereby it was ordered that your Petitioner be confined in the United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island for the period of One (1) year and Three (3) months. That thereafter your Petitioner was removed from said District and Territory of Alaska by the United States Marshal thereof and delivered into the custody of the said 0. P. Halligan, as such Warden of the said United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, on the 19th day of August 1915
V

That at the time of the delivery of the body of your Petitioner by the said United States Marshal of said District of Alaska to the said Warden of said Penitentiary at McNeil Island no proper or legal commitment, mittimus or other legal process or authority was delivered to the said Warden of said United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island authorizing said Warden to imprison or detain your Petitioner in any manner whatsoever and that your Petitioner at all times since said 19th day of August 1915, has been so held and detained and restrained of his said liberty by the said O.P. Halligan, as Warden of said United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, wholly without authority of any Court or Judge of any Court and contrary to the rights of your Petitioner as a citizen of the United States and in violation of the said constitution and laws of the United States
VI

That your Petitioner was not and is not guilty of the said above mentioned alleged crime of detaining, delaying, and embezzling mail matter or any crime against the laws of the United States and that the said above mentioned conviction of your Petitioner in the said District court for the District
of Alaska was wholly contrary to law and contrary to the facts in said Alaska was not authorized by the law or the facts in said case to pronounce any valid judgment or sentence against your Petitioner

WHEREFORE your Petitioner respectfully prays the Court that a Writ of habeas corpus be issued herein directed to the said O.P. Halligan, as Warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil Island, State of Washington, and directing the said O.P. Halligan, as such Warden, to produce the body of your Petitioner before the Court and to show by virtue of what claim or authority the said O.P. Halligan, as such Warden, detains your Petitioner and restrains him of his liberty as herein set forth and that upon the hearing of said Writ that your Petitioner be released and discharged from the custody of said Warden.
Thomas L Thurston Petitioner
J. Henry Dennng Attorney For Petitioner
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF PIERCE } SS

THOMAS L THURSTON, being first duly sworn, upon his oath, deposes and says: That he is the Petitoner named in the above and foregoing Petition. That he has read said Petition, knows the contents thereof, and that the facts stated in said Petition are true as he verily believes.
Thomas L Thurston
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 8th day of October 1915
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In re PETITION OF THOMAS L THURSTON FOR A WRIT OF habeas corpus
FILED IN THe U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION OCT 11 1915 By EmL 2x Deputy
PETITION FOR WRIT
J. HENRY DENNING
Office Starr-Boyd Building, SEATTLE
611-614 LYON BLDG. THIRD AVE. & JAMES
Attorny for Petitioner
SPEAR SEATTLE
